# Modern Astronomy 

Studying the Universe reveals many things


:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="45%"}
- Stars generate energy by fusing light elements $\rightarrow$ heavy elements
- Stars die and throw material out into the cosmos
- New stars and planets form
- Almost every atom in our bodies was forged in a star 
:::
::: {.column width="55%"}

::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"}

:::

# [1.2 The Nature of Science](https://openstax.org/books/astronomy-2e/pages/1-2-the-nature-of-science)

# Scientific ideas change over time 

<iframe width=1000px height=600px src="https://astro.unl.edu/classaction/animations/renaissance/pathtracer.html"></iframe>

# Hypothesis

An idea that has **testable** and **falsifiable** predictions.

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}

Is a hypothesis

::: {.callout-note icon=false}
# Speed of light is constant
- Can be falsified. Find one thing moving faster.
- Leads to *Theory of Special Relativity*.

:::
:::
::: {.column width="50%"}

Is not a hypothesis

::: {.callout-important icon=false}
# A teacup orbits Mars
- Can't be falsified? You haven't looked hard enough.
- Has no predicting utility.
:::
:::

::::


# Scientific Ideas Change {.center }

Have you ever heard of the Luminiferous ether?

![[Concept of the aether wind across the solar system.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michelson%E2%80%93Morley_experiment#/media/File:AetherWind.svg) ](figures/01/AetherWind.svg){#fig-aether-wind fig-align="left"} 

::: {.fragment}
- Hypothesized material to explain how light travels through vacuum of space.
-  It was wrong!

Old ideas are rejected in science! 
:::

# Scientific Progress


:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="65%"}
Science's vulnerability is its greatest strength!

Einstein's Cosmological constant

- Proposed to "fix" the dynamic universe predicted by Einstein's equations.
- Ultimately rejected as more evidence discovered.
- "my greatest mistake" - Einstein
:::
::: {.column width="30%"}

![[Biking in circles trying to fix his equations.](https://digital.archives.caltech.edu/islandora/object/image%3A1780) ](figures/01/Einstein-Bike.jpg){#fig-ein-bike fig-align="left"} 
:::

# [1.4 Numbers in Astronomy](https://openstax.org/books/astronomy-2e/pages/1-4-numbers-in-astronomy)

- Our job as scientist is to comprehend the seemingly incomprehensible.
- Our brains go numb when we see long strings of digits like $263541456.87324$
- Use scientific notation to focus on the size of the number: $2.64\times10^8$

::: {.callout-important icon=false}
## Question
How many marbles do I have?

# Counting the "Million-Man Watch"


:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="40%"}
::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"}
![[National Mall on 16 Oct 1995.](https://www.loc.gov/item/2015645181/) ](figures/01/service-pnp-ppmsca-38800-38892r.jpg){#fig-million-man-watch fig-align="center"}
::: 
:::
::: {.column width="60%"}

How many people at the Million Man march?

**Depends on who you ask.**

- March Organizers estimated 1.5 - 2 million people

- US Park Police estimated 400,000

- Boston University estimated 837,000 with 20% margin of error. 
  <br>
  669,600 $<$ Crowd Size $<$ 1,004,400

:::
